news_header: South Korea has banned new downloads of China's DeepSeek AI chatbot due to personal data protection concerns. The app became popular quickly, reaching over a million weekly users, but faced scrutiny from various countries.
news_original_title: S Korea removes Deepseek from app stores over privacy concerns
news_text: The South Korean government has stated that the app will be available again once it complies with local data protection laws. Other countries, including Taiwan and Australia, have also imposed restrictions on DeepSeek, citing national security risks. The app's rapid rise has raised questions about data privacy and the implications for the AI industry.
